page.title: 08SLAITHWAITE RAILWAY STATION.
page.content: In December 1982, British Rail re-opened Slaithwaite Station in response to public demand.Slaithwaite is on the MetroTrain 11 Line,known as the Huddersfield Line, which runs between Leeds and Manchester,although half of the westward-bound trains terminate at Marsden,the next station up the line. There are 28 trains which stop to pick up passengers every weekday;14 in either direction.On Saturday there are 20 trains altogether but on Sunday the station is closed.The service is good generally.Most journies originating from Slaithwaite are taken before 2pm. 100-120 people on weekdays travel towards Leeds and 20 head west.Figures for Saturday are 150 and 20 respect- ively.Few people travel to Slaithwaite from other areas.The Peak Time fare to Huddersfield is 50p.Off peak is 30p.
